qas.question: Baptists have issued what without considering them to be creeds?
Most Baptists are what in doctrine?
Baptists have played a key role in what?

answers.text: encouraging religious freedom and separation of church and state.

qas.question: Which group of Christians are not defined by doctrine?
Baptists have issued what while considering them to be creeds?

plausible_answers.text: encouraging religious freedom and separation of church and state

qas.question: Baptists have played a small role in what?

context: <b4_0>Baptists<b4_0/>, like other Christians, are defined by <a0_0>doctrine<a0_0/>—some of it common to all orthodox and evangelical groups and a portion of it distinctive to Baptists. Through the years, different Baptist groups have issued <a1_0><b5_0>confessions of faith<b5_0/><a1_0/>—without considering them to be creeds—to express their particular doctrinal distinctions in comparison to other Christians as well as in comparison to other Baptists. Most Baptists are <a2_0><b6_0>evangelical<b6_0/><a2_0/> in doctrine, but Baptist beliefs can vary due to the congregational governance system that gives autonomy to individual local Baptist churches. Historically, Baptists have played a key role in <a3_0><b7_0>encouraging religious freedom and separation of church and state<b7_0/>.
